p: Different steps of lignan transformation in the human gut are catalyzed by different bacterial species including Clostridium spp., Bacterioides spp., Eubacterium spp. [ 150]. The final dehydrogenation of enterodiol into enterolactone was catalyzed by a new strictly anaerobic bacterium [ 148], which was later characterized and named Lactonifactor longoviformis [ 154]. Ruminococcus sp. isolated from human intestine also transformed enterodiol into enterolactone [ 155].
